overview.title: Overview
overview.content: Foodbrain is committed to protecting your personal data and ensuring compliance with applicable data protection laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) for users in the European Economic Area (EEA). This page outlines our data protection practices, your rights, and how we handle your information.

categories.title: Categories of Data We Process
categories.contactContent: Email address, phone number, or postal address
categories.healthContent: Dietary preferences, allergies, health goals, and nutritional requirements
categories.technicalContent: IP address, browser type, operating system, and device information
categories.usageContent: Information about how you use our services

purposes.title: Purposes of Processing
purposes.content: We process your data for the following purposes:
purposes.purpose2: Improving and optimizing our AI services
purposes.purpose3: Managing your account and providing customer support
purposes.purpose6: Analyzing usage patterns to enhance user experience

securityMeasures.title: Security Measures
securityMeasures.intro: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data:
securityMeasures.encryptionContent: Data is encrypted in transit using TLS/SSL protocols and at rest using industry-standard encryption
securityMeasures.accessContent: Role-based access controls limit data access to authorized personnel only
securityMeasures.infrastructureContent: Our systems are hosted in secure data centers with physical access controls
securityMeasures.auditsContent: Security assessments and vulnerability scans are conducted regularly
securityMeasures.minimizationContent: We only collect data necessary for the purposes stated
securityMeasures.trainingContent: Staff receive regular data protection and security training

dataRetention.title: Data Retention Periods
dataRetention.intro: We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected. Specific retention periods are based on:
dataRetention.factor1: The purpose for which the data was collected
dataRetention.factor3: The nature of the data (especially sensitive health data)
dataRetention.healthNote: Health and nutritional data is typically retained for the duration of your account plus a reasonable period thereafter to allow for account reactivation. Account data is deleted within 30 days of account closure request, except where retention is required by law.

userRights.title: Your Rights
userRights.intro: Under applicable data protection laws, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:
userRights.accessContent: You can request a copy of the personal data we hold about you.
userRights.rectificationContent: You can request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.
userRights.erasureContent: You can request deletion of your personal data ("right to be forgotten").
userRights.restrictionContent: You can request that we limit how we use your data.
userRights.portabilityContent: You can request transfer of your data to another service provider.
userRights.objectionContent: You can object to processing based on legitimate interests.
userRights.exerciseContent: To exercise any of these rights, please contact us using the information provided at the end of this page. We will respond to your request within 30 days. We may need to verify your identity before processing certain requests.

internationalTransfers.title: International Data Transfers
internationalTransfers.intro: Your data may be transferred to and processed in countries other than your country of residence. These countries may have data protection laws that are different from the laws of your country.
internationalTransfers.safeguards: When we transfer data internationally, we implement appropriate safeguards to ensure your data receives adequate protection, including:
internationalTransfers.safeguard1: Standard contractual clauses approved by the European Commission
internationalTransfers.safeguard2: Transfer to countries with adequate data protection decisions
internationalTransfers.safeguard3: Binding corporate rules for transfers within our corporate group
internationalTransfers.safeguard4: Other appropriate safeguards as required by applicable law

complaints.title: Complaint Procedures
complaints.intro: If you have concerns about how we handle your personal data, we encourage you to contact us first so we can address your concerns. However, you also have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.
complaints.lodgeContent: If you are located in the European Economic Area (EEA), you have the right to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority in your member state. You can find contact details for your national data protection authority on the European Data Protection Board website.
complaints.germany: Germany: Bundesbeauftragte für den Datenschutz und die Informationsfreiheit (BfDI)
complaints.france: France: Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des Libertés (CNIL)

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this Data Protection page from time to time. We will notify you of any material changes by posting the updated policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date.
